Our journey as a healthcare provider began in March 2006 with the establishment of the Cardiac Centre, in Victoria Island, in association with the renowned Cromwell Hospital in London.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Physiotherapist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Physiotherapist will be responsible for assessing, planning, and implementing therapeutic interventions to help patients restore mobility, improve physical function, relieve pain, and prevent disability.
	The ideal candidate must demonstrate strong clinical skills, professionalism, and a patient-centered approach while working collaboratively within a multidisciplinary healthcare team.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients&rsquo; physical conditions and functional abilities.
	Develop individualized treatment plans based on clinical findings and patient goals.
	Provide physiotherapy interventions, including therapeutic exercises, manual therapy, electrotherapy, and rehabilitation techniques.
	Monitor patient progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary.
	Educate patients and caregivers on home exercise programs, injury prevention, and lifestyle modifications.
	Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other allied health professionals to ensure coordinated patient care.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient documentation and rehabilitation records.
	Ensure adherence to safety, infection control, and professional standards.
	Participate in departmental meetings, training, and continuous professional development activities.
	Contribute to quality improvement initiatives within the physiotherapy unit.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Physiotherapy from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 2&ndash;3 years of post-qualification experience in a reputable healthcare facility.
	Current license to practice with the Medical Rehabilitation Therapists (Registration) Board of Nigeria (MRTB).
	Proficiency in musculoskeletal, neurological, cardiopulmonary, and orthopedic rehabilitation techniques.
	Strong clinical reasoning, assessment, and therapeutic skills.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and patient-handling abilities.
	Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and professional ethics.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@reddingtonhospital.com&nbsp;CC:&nbsp;imoleayo.arowosegbe@reddingtonhospital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

        The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital built on nine floors provides fully comprehensive tertiary hospital solutions in most medical areas. Our journey as a healthcare provider began in March 2006 with the establishment of the Cardiac Centre, in Victoria Island, in association with the renowned Cromwell Hospital in London.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Physiotherapist

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Physiotherapist will be responsible for assessing, planning, and implementing therapeutic interventions to help patients restore mobility, improve physical function, relieve pain, and prevent disability.
	The ideal candidate must demonstrate strong clinical skills, professionalism, and a patient-centered approach while working collaboratively within a multidisciplinary healthcare team.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients’ physical conditions and functional abilities.
	Develop individualized treatment plans based on clinical findings and patient goals.
	Provide physiotherapy interventions, including therapeutic exercises, manual therapy, electrotherapy, and rehabilitation techniques.
	Monitor patient progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary.
	Educate patients and caregivers on home exercise programs, injury prevention, and lifestyle modifications.
	Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other allied health professionals to ensure coordinated patient care.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient documentation and rehabilitation records.
	Ensure adherence to safety, infection control, and professional standards.
	Participate in departmental meetings, training, and continuous professional development activities.
	Contribute to quality improvement initiatives within the physiotherapy unit.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Physiotherapy from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 2–3 years of post-qualification experience in a reputable healthcare facility.
	Current license to practice with the Medical Rehabilitation Therapists (Registration) Board of Nigeria (MRTB).
	Proficiency in musculoskeletal, neurological, cardiopulmonary, and orthopedic rehabilitation techniques.
	Strong clinical reasoning, assessment, and therapeutic skills.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and patient-handling abilities.
	Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and professional ethics.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@reddingtonhospital.com CC: imoleayo.arowosegbe@reddingtonhospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Commercial Finance Manager",
  "description": "Workforce Group is a Management Consulting and Outsourcing Professional Services Firm. Following its inception in July 2004, Workforce Management Centre Limited (Workforce) has built an enviable reputation as the leading indigenous management and professional services consulting firm in Nigeria. Drawing from its Deep Domain Expertise, in the area of organizational effectiveness and employee performance, the Company is positioned to assist businesses across diverse sectors of the economy in their quest to create sustainable value for their stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Commercial Finance Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos City, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecommunication

Job Summary


	We are looking for a highly skilled Commercial Finance Manager to provide financial leadership, guide commercial decision-making, and support business profitability across our operations.
	This role requires a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and deep experience in fast-paced environments.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes for commercial functions
	Analyze sales performance, pricing, trade spend, and market trends to support strategic growth

Accountant Job at Pruvia Integrated Limited




        
    

        
        Pruvia Integrated Limited (PIL) - Our client in the automobile industry is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Osogbo, Osun (willing to relocate)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Automobile

Job Brief
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client in the automobile industry is seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Accountant to join their dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing day-to-day financial operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and supporting business decisions through insightful financial analysis.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Process accounts payable and receivable, ensuring timely settlements and reconciliations.
	Prepare customer invoices and reconcile payments for vehicle sales, spare parts, and automobile services.
	Track and reconcile inventory for vehicles, spare parts, and workshop materials.
	Monitor cost of goods sold (COGS), including vehicle acquisition costs and workshop usage.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and prepare statutory returns (VAT, PAYE, WHT).
	Support internal and external audit activities with required documentation.
	Maintain fixed asset registers and track depreciation schedules.
	Provide financial analysis, cost-control insights, and performance reports to management.
	Collaborate with sales, workshop, procurement, and inventory teams to ensure financial accuracy.
	Validate job cards, service invoices, and workshop expenses before posting.


Requirements


	HND / BSc Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 4 years of accounting experience (automobile industry experience is a strong advantage).
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, ANAN) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, Tally, or SAP.
	Strong analytical skills and excellent attention to detail.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines.


Key Competencies:


	Strong numerical and financial reporting skills
	Knowledge of automotive accounting procedures
	Integrity, professionalism, and high ethical standards
	Strong problem-solving abilities and organizational skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.
